Articles.Content: Hello I am asking to see if anyone knows of a way or program to make/edit float curves on linux. I know of this "[mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93332-INFO-KSP-floatCurves-and-you-the-magic-of-tangents)", but the [unity editor](https://unity3d.com/get-unity/download?ref=personal) is windows and mac only.

This will run ingame as a partmodule:

[http://svn.mumech.com/KSP/trunk/MuMechLib/FloatCurveEditor.cs](http://svn.mumech.com/KSP/trunk/MuMechLib/FloatCurveEditor.cs)

> 
> This will run ingame as a partmodule:
> [http://svn.mumech.com/KSP/trunk/MuMechLib/FloatCurveEditor.cs](http://svn.mumech.com/KSP/trunk/MuMechLib/FloatCurveEditor.cs)

So...uh...what would you do with that to get it to work in-game?

> 
> This will run ingame as a partmodule:
> [http://svn.mumech.com/KSP/trunk/MuMechLib/FloatCurveEditor.cs](http://svn.mumech.com/KSP/trunk/MuMechLib/FloatCurveEditor.cs)

Any chance you'd compile it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Please! I tried to do so in mono dev but had some errors I have no idea how to solve. Still learning just the basic of coding unfortunately :/
